profileAlternative.name: Nandini Shankar
profileAlternative.headline: Embedded Engineer Intern at Carbon
profileAlternative.summary:
I have 6 years of experience in Active Safety Radar Based Systems. As Embedded Software Engineer, my responsibilities included
* Developing software for Inter Processor Communication using Shared Memory, Semaphores,Device Drivers and Interrupt Controller.
* Testing Radar algorithms such as Static Alignment and Blockage on Radar ECU.
* Have worked on communication protocols such as SPI, I2C, UART and CAN.
* PC re-simulation using low level logged data (from CAN and UDP) to verify the ADAS and Radar algorithms.
* Integrating ADAS algorithms like Cross Traffic Alert, Lane Change Alert, Lance Change Assist, Cyclist Alert and so on into Side Radar Systems on NXP Race Runner Ultra Tri-Core Micro-controller. Owned the responsibility of the one of the core in the Radar ECU for the customer Jaguar Land Rover.
* Understanding the customer requirements, designing, coding and testing them using the prerecorded live data from the test cars. Performing timely project releases, bug fixes for test cars was also part of my responsibilities.

I am proficient in C and C++ with good knowledge of Lauterbach Trace 32, Eclipse, VisualStudio, CANalyzer, CANoe, MATLAB, Simulink, Plastics and FreeRTOS.

positions.title: Embedded Engineer Intern
positions.description:
* Developing bootloader with Direct Firmware Update mode for Texas Instruments MCU via USB .
* Developing an application which helps the user to switch between the different boot modes.

given.text:
Nandini is truly dedicated and skilled professional. Its was a previlage for me to work with her.

We worked in the same team and she is highly skilled in the domain both in development and debugging skills. She has proficient knowledge in Programming and which was highly helpful in debugging and analysing critical issues in the project.

She was keen and patient in doing the task assigned and was always cheerful. Happy that she is pursuing her dreams and Wishing you the very best in all future endeavours. See less
